posts.html:
@TheWrathofShane

MTG already has demons, angels, priests, spirits, ghouls, demi-gods, avatars...

So suddenly with the addition of "devil" it becomes too much? What about cards like Wrath of God? Why do you even have to explain to them anyway? Unless you're playing MTG at church, I honestly don't see how its any of their business. Its just a game. To be played by YOU in your OWN PERSONAL TIME. How absurd of them to be hung up about such minor inconsequential things. They'd probably think Harry Potter and rock songs are the work of the devil too...pfft
Report Abuse

Rating:

posts.post_content: Makes you remember how good [flametongue kavu](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=flametongue kavu) was. It costs less mana, has a higher power, and can kill creatures with four toughness the turn it enters play.

Posted By: RAV0004 (4/27/2012 7:44:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At Wizards-  
  
Designer #1: "Hey, guys. Remember how popular [Pitchburn Devils](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pitchburn Devils) was? What if we make a more expensive version that basically does the same thing?"  
Designer #2: "Excellent idea, only let's print it at uncommon. We can't let a card *this* powerful appear in packs too frequently."  
  
And thus, [Gang of Devils](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gang of Devils) was born.
posts.html:
At Wizards-

Designer #1: "Hey, guys. Remember how popular Pitchburn Devils was? What if we make a more expensive version that basically does the same thing?"
Designer #2: "Excellent idea, only let's print it at uncommon. We can't let a card this powerful appear in packs too frequently."

And thus, Gang of Devils was born.

posts.post_content:
Pretty sure the designers got their 3's and 6's mixed up. 3 or 4CMC with same effect? Absolutely. Or 6 damage instead of 3? Would tap that. 6/3? Maybe.  
  
0.5/5 - "WTF is this I don't even" when I pulled from a booster.

Posted By: Weisse (6/27/2012 12:12:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Personally, I love the card. The art's really nice, and the ability is pretty cool. Yes, a 3/3 that costs 6 is a bit disappointing, but I find it to be really useful in standard. It's very similar to the [Pitchburn Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pitchburn Devil)s, but I find that the flexibility this one offers actually makes a big difference.
